urls.description: One of my most important jobs is making government work for you. urls.title: Cicilline to Lead Rhode Island Foundation | Congressman David Cicilline
urls.description: WASHINGTON, D.C. – Today, Congressman David Cicilline (D-RI), currently serving his seventh term in the United States House of Representatives, announced he has been selected to lead the Rhode Island Foundation as its President and CEO and will be leaving elected office effective June 1, 2023.   A member of House Democratic Leadership and a senior member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee and the House Committee on the Judiciary, Cicilline released the following statement:

tweets.text:
Serving the people of Rhode Island’s First District has been the honor of my lifetime.

The chance to lead the Rhode Island Foundation was unexpected, but it is an extraordinary opportunity to have an even more direct impact.

My full statement ⤵️
https://t.co/gVNOtlTgPk

urls.title: Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi Appointed to Serve As Ranking Member On House Select Committee on Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party

tweets.text:

Because of my abortion, I could escape permanent poverty for me and my daughter and forge a new path.

It meant I could write my own destiny. https://t.co/Pu9foKBYiQ

urls.title: Push is on to boost troops’ housing allowance - Roll Call
urls.description: Congress pushes the Defense Department to cover all of its Basic Allowance for Housing to put less financial strain on troops.

tweets.text:
Today, I introduced the BAH Restoration Act with @RepDonBacon and @SenatorWarnock to make housing more affordable for servicemembers and their families on and off base.

Meeting their basic needs should be a #nationalsecurity priority.

https://t.co/NKr2rm75Wu
